intro: Caiophora angustisecta, commonly known as the narrow-leaf caiophora, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
